TextJPN: 「…にしても、縁結びの勾玉かぁ。@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3027.使い方によっては、世界平和にも利用できそうなんだけどな」
TextENG: ``...Anyway, a matchmaking magatama, huh?@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3027. Depending how it's used, that might be able to lead toward world peace.``

TextJPN: 「世界平和ぁ？@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3038.　なんか、えらくスケールの大きな話が出たね。@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3039.それって、いったいどうやって？」
TextENG: ``World peeeace?@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3038. That seems like a rather large-scale proposal.@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3039. Just how might you go about that?``

TextJPN: 「ほら、あれだ。@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3029.紛争とかでいがみ合ってる二つの国の偉い人に渡すんだ。@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3030.そうしたらお互いに仲良くなって、めでたしめでたしじゃないか」
TextENG: ``Here's what you do.@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3029. Give it to the leaders of two countries that are in the middle of some kinda dispute.@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3030. That way, they'd be able to get along and live happily ever after.``

TextJPN: 「…いくらなんでも、お国の対立問題でそう簡単にはまいりませんわ。@k@vS20/04/VTT_satoko3017.上の方が仲直りしても、他の方々が納得しなければ同じことですし。@k@vS20/04/VTT_satoko3018.二人とも職を追われておしまいだと思いますわよ？」
TextENG: ``...There's no way that would solve all of a country's problems.@k@vS20/04/VTT_satoko3017. Even if the higher ups are able to reconcile, it won't change anything unless the people around them are able to come to an agreement.@k@vS20/04/VTT_satoko3018. The two of them would just be forced out of their jobs, don't you think?``

TextJPN: 「それに、あの勾玉だと一方的に好きになって、相手の気持ちはお構い無しだもんね。@k@vS20/02/VTT_rena3022.それって好きって感情とは、ちょっと違うと思う。@k@vS20/02/VTT_rena3023.むしろ依存とか従属とか、…あんまり幸せな感じじゃないね」
TextENG: ``Plus, that magatama only gives you one-sided affection with no consideration for your partner's feelings.@k@vS20/02/VTT_rena3022. I think that's a little different from genuinely liking someone.@k@vS20/02/VTT_rena3023. That's more like dependence or servitude... not a very happy feeling.``

TextJPN: 「やっぱり、恋愛はお互いに好きあって理解してこそ成立するものなんだって、レナは思うよ」
TextENG: ``Ultimately, love is only possible when two people like and understand one another, that's what Rena thinks.``

TextJPN: 「ま、そういう意味では国家は大げさとしても、仲間同士の信頼関係にも同じことが言えるかもしれません。@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3002.便利な道具を使って、理由も根拠もなくこっちに好意を向けさせるなんて虫が良すぎます」
TextENG: ``Well, in that sense, if national change is too much to ask for, then the same could probably be said for trust between friends.@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3002. Using some convenient tool to make people like each other without any reason or rationale just sounds too good to be true.``

TextJPN: 「結局泥臭くても、理解の積み重ねが大事ってことなんでしょうね」
TextENG: ``In the end, even if it's unrefined, the important thing is developing mutual understanding.``

TextJPN: 「ん～、理解かぁ。@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3032.言葉にすると簡単だけど、なかなか難しいよな。@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3033.仲のいい相手のことを考えてるつもりでも、こっちの思惑と全然違ってることのほうが多いし…」
TextENG: ``Hmm~, understanding, huh?@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3032. That's an easy thing to say, but pretty tough to actually do.@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3033. You might think you're trying to be considerate of someone close to you, but in a lot of cases they were thinking something completely different...``

TextJPN: 「そもそも相手のため、って考え方自体が傲慢なのかもしれないね。@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3041.それってすごく、自分を相手よりも高みに置いてる思考なんだから」
TextENG: ``Maybe it's arrogant to be thinking for someone else's sake in the first place.@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3041. Because when you think like that, you're totally putting yourself on a higher pedestal than the other person.``

TextJPN: 「だったら本音をぶつけ合ったほうが、逆に理解が深まるってこともあるんじゃないかなぁ」
TextENG: ``In which case, there are times when it's better to share our true feelings with one another so we can deepen our understanding of each other.``

TextJPN: 「…とても深い話なのです。みぃ」
TextENG: ``...This story is very deep. Meep.``

TextJPN: 「…ほっほぉ？@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3005.　だったらお姉、今持ってる本音を圭ちゃんにぶつけてみなさいな。@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3006.意外に理解が深まるかもしれませんよ～？」
TextENG: ``...Hohoh?@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3005. Then Sis, why don't you share your true feelings with Kei-chan, right here and now?@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3006. You might be surprised how deeply you'll be able to understand one another~.``

TextJPN: 「えっ？@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3044.　い、いやその、そ、それとこれとは…」
TextENG: ``Huh?@k@vS20/03/VTT_mion3044. N-no, well, th-this and that are, umm...``

TextJPN: 「ん？@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3035.　なんだ魅音、俺に何かあるってのか？@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3036.　言ってみろよ、ほれほれ」
TextENG: ``Hmm?@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3035. What is it, Mion? You've got something to tell me?@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3036. Go ahead and say it.``

TextJPN: 「いっ、いいいい、言えるわけないでしょぉぉッッ！！」
TextENG: ``Th-th-th-there's no way I can say thaaaat!!``

TextJPN: 「……。@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3038.なぁレナ、魅音出て行っちまったが、…なんで俺はぶん殴られたんだ？@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3039.　やっぱりこれも、本人に疑問をぶつけるべきなんだろうか？」
TextENG: ``...@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3038. Hey Rena... why did Mion just beat me and then storm out?@k@vS20/01/VTT_keiichi3039. Right, maybe this is another thing I should be asking the person in question directly?``

TextJPN: 「さぁてね？@k@vS20/02/VTT_rena3026.　レナは知ぃらな～い♪」
TextENG: ``I wondeeer?@k@vS20/02/VTT_rena3026. Rena doesn't knoooow~♪.``

TextJPN: 「まったく…。@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3008.デリカシーないのはお互い様ってやつですか？@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3009.　前途は多難ですねぇ」
TextENG: ``Unbelievable...@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3008. Are they both equally clueless?@k@vS20/06/VTT_shion3009. The road ahead is going to be full of difficulties.``

TextJPN: 「…とはいえ、この件で圭一さんに理解を深めろってのは酷かもしれませんわ」
TextENG: ``...Although, perhaps expecting Keiichi-san to be more understanding on this matter is too much to ask for.``

TextJPN: 「ギャルゲー主人公のお約束なのですよ、にぱー☆」
TextENG: ``That is the cliche for a galge protagonist, nipah☆.``
